title: NIrish
author: NIrish
content: I am having issues with alerts from Coin Stats on my android phone, some don't show up as an alert at all and it just disappears from my alert list.Sometimes if numerous alerts happen concurrently I only receive one of them and have no idea which others have triggered.There also appears to be no way to view which alerts have triggered??  Is this correct?  They just disappear from the alert list with no record of them??Same for anyone else??Ideally I'd like to resolve the issues rather than use another app as I have my portfolio tracker set up successfully on Coin Stats app!!

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: What kind of alert are you really talking about? Is it an alert set on your exchange accounts or an alert set on your personal private wallet, or is it some of the market trackers like Coingecko or CoinMarketCap? You need to be specific so that one can know where you are coming from and how to be off-hand.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Maybe your mobile device has a problem.Are you receiving the alerts as mobile notifications or as email notifications? If it's the former, then it's very likely there is a battery or power saving setting that shuts down your apps from running in the background, and therefore you won't be able to get notifications in real time.

comments.author: NIrish
comments.body: It's simply price alerts on various coins where I'd like to buy more or take potentially take profits.A lot of the time they do work but some definitely haven't shown up and I know their price has been bypassed as they've disappeared from my list of alerts.My main issue is when multiple alerts are triggered (as is often the case as the market moves as one) it only shows me one in my notifications and there is no record on the app that I can find to show what other alerts have been triggered.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: Quote from: NIrish on May 09, 2023, 08:43:50 PMIt's simply price alerts on various coins where I'd like to buy more or take potentially take profits.A lot of the time they do work but some definitely haven't shown up and I know their price has been bypassed as they've disappeared from my list of alerts.My main issue is when multiple alerts are triggered (as is often the case as the market moves as one) it only shows me one in my notifications and there is no record on the app that I can find to show what other alerts have been triggered.Don't worry yourself over price alerts because if the price of a coin didn't go up or come down,there will be no alert notification. The moment you have gotten any alert notification and it don't show up for easy access, why don't you login to the app to confirm for yourself. If it is a wallet that you are talking about,then this depends on the type of wallet that you are using. I have a trust wallet that notifies me in any price change in bitcoin especially. What I do is that I will login and check other coins too if there was also a change in the price. Sometimes, the problem might be from your phone.

comments.author: NIrish
comments.body: I'm really sorry, but I have no idea what the previous two comments are trying to say.  Maybe we have a difference of language.Very simply, the alerts don't all show for me when they trigger on CoinStats.I am wondering if I have overlooked anything.  I would also like to see which alerts have triggered rather than them just disappear.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: I never heard this CoinStats before, is this reliable in real-time price tracking?Might there be occasional technical glitches or delays in data reporting that can affect the reliability of this price alert you've used?  Why not try another one? This website CoinTracking.Which is also available on mobile apps. Anyway, AFAIK, any exchange has a real-time price alert, isn't it?If yes, then it's good to use.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Did you try toggling the "Alert Frequency" and/or "Sensitivity"? perhaps it is too low for your use case?Quote from: https://help.coinstats.app/en/articles/3573865-how-to-set-up-custom-alerts...Choose alert frequency (how many times)Quote from: https://help.coinstats.app/en/articles/2332478-price-notificationsAfter enabling the alert, you can choose Low, Medium, or High sensitivity. For example, suppose you wish to get many notifications and always be up to date, even with minor changes. In that case, you can set the sensitivity to high so CoinStats can constantly notify you about the changes.I haven't seen any alerts history or some sort either.Side note: Lmk if I did not get the app right lol

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: I have the same issue but not only on CoinStats but also on other apps but I solve the issue by turning off the power saving mode and manually turning off the unused apps in sleep mode or deep sleep. Or you can just remove the CoinStat app from sleep mode so that it will run in the background without pushing your app to sleep when not in use.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Quote from: NIrish on May 09, 2023, 07:11:56 PMI am having issues with alerts from Coin Stats on my android phone, some don't show up as an alert at all and it just disappears from my alert list.There's nothing like alert disappearance om your device except you have a malicious physhing attack currently running onnyour device unknowingly to you, you can also try check your alert notification settings on their page and on your mobile device as well, the function might have been disabled, lastly, if you constantly receives alert from them and you don't cluck to open them, theyay reduce the numbers of alerts being sent and if not changes, they may decided to stop sending you alert, if this happens to be the case, try and disable the alert notification and enable it back to opt you in again.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: I suffer from the same problem in my phone, and the reason for this is that modern phones try to preserve the battery for the longest time, and therefore most of the active applications are closed periodically due to power restrictions.Go to your device settings and exclude the application from the "Power Saving" option, or whatever option appears to you.There is another option, which is to choose to receive notifications by e-mail. Almost the e-mail application comes by default, with the exception of energy saving restrictions, and its notifications work well.

comments.author: Razmirraz
comments.body: Quote from: NIrish on May 09, 2023, 10:02:24 PMVery simply, the alerts don't all show for me when they trigger on CoinStats.I had never heard of CoinStats before. I fully understand your point above, the problem you are facing indicates that CoinStats cannot be fully relied upon to track real-time prices due to several constraints that occur as you experience.Many issues are triggered due to late warnings, technical issues are inevitable with events like this. When the warning for a coin that you expected never appears, you should look directly at sites that serve real-time price movements such as coingecko.com.
